physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two military officers in dark uniforms with headgear. They are wearing long-sleeved collared top
 with their ranks attached to the right sleeve. Behind them
 there are several white tents seen. The photograph is quite crumpled
 with several fold lines seen.

sgcool_label_text:A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony
 this collection is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Military officers in front of tent
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It features two military officers in dark uniforms with headgear. They are wearing long-sleeved collared top, with their ranks attached to the right sleeve. Behind them, there are several white tents seen. The photograph is quite crumpled, with several fold lines seen.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
